messages.title: Campaigning for a future fair for all in Brighton Pavilion

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour's plans support people back to work, halve the deficit and offer a fair future for all.
Labour's investing in the NHS and defending your right to see a cancer specialist within two weeks.
Labour's working for smarter schools to give our local children a commitment to smaller class sizes.
Labour's guaranteeing young people a job, training or work if out of work for 6 months.
Labour's action plan for crime is to support more visible and responsive neighbourhood policing.

issues.education: Labour working for smarter schools, smaller class sizes, and investing in our local children.
issues.health: Labour plans to protect the NHS, investing in services and guaranteeing the right to see a cancer specialist within two weeks.

housing.content: Keeping your street market alive, delivering new play areas and fighting to keep the number 81 bus.

leaflet.personalStatement: For over 20 years, I've worked for the public sector, trade unions, charities, increasing families and children's life chances.

contactInformation.address: Brighton Pavilion Labour Party, 179 Preston Road, Brighton, BN1 6AG

endorsements.endorsement: After nearly 13 years as your MP, I'm retiring at the next General Elections but standing for Nancy Platts in this election. She's an energetic and strategic campaigner who believes in care and social justice. We are campaigning for the future.

images.caption: Nancy Platts with Climate Change Secretary, Ed Miliband, who introduced the first ever Climate Change Act.
